nav.div: Estacada School District » Parents/Community » Virtual School Day Guidance

p.style: line-height: 1.7em; letter-spacing: 0.3px; margin: 0px 0px 15px; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
p.strong: Virtual School Days Are In Effect
p.br:
With student and staff safety and health in mind, the Estacada School Board voted on March 12th to proactively close all Estacada schools and transition to distance learning for March 16th-20th. Virtual learning has now been extended through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.
What will virtual learning look like?
All students have been equipped with the tools necessary to engage in our innovative distance learning program. Elementary students have been sent home with packets, and secondary students have Chromebook lessons via Google Classroom and Canvas.
All students must check in with their teacher(s) once per day Monday through Thursday order to be an attendance for the virtual school day. Your child's teacher will reach out via email, phone, Google Classroom, or Zoom. If you need to contact your child's teacher, all contact information is available below.
What if I don't have internet?
Access to learning for ALL students is a priority of ours. Our teachers and technology staff have worked quickly to identify many students that do not have internet and distributed hotspots that can provide internet access to those without it currently.
All teachers can be contacted via phone in lieu of email for families that do not have internet.
What if we need food services?
We have options to feed all children in need during Distance Learning days. We are delivering meals Monday through Friday, and have partnered with the Estacada Food Bank to deliver groceries to four community sites. Learn more here.
How is my special needs student being supported?
Learning specialists, teachers, case managers, and paraeducators are all working together to ensure that children's individual needs are met during distance learning. If you have a specific question, please find your child's learning specialist's or teacher's contact information below and feel free to reach out.
What if I have questions?
You're not alone in this, and we are here to support you! We appreciate you learning alongside us as we pilot this unique opportunity.
If you have technology, password, and login questions email esdhelpdesk@estacada.k12.or.us or in case of emergency or no email access, call 503-630-6871 ext. 2893.
If you have food needs or questions about food delivery/pickup call 503-630-8606 ext. 2950.
Questions for your teacher or learning specialist? Look them up in the spreadsheets below.
General questions or not sure who to contact? Give us a call at 503-630-6871. We'll get you pointed in the right direction.
Contact Information By Building

div.span: The Estacada School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, religion or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following staff has been designated to handle inquiries regarding nondiscrimination policies for the school district: Student Service Director, 255 NE 6th Avenue, Estacada, OR, 97023. 503-630-6871.
